description: From Middle English fusible, from Old French fusible, from Medieval Latin fusibilis.

adjectives.description: fusible (comparative more fusible, superlative most fusible)

entries.meaning: Able to be fused or melted.
Any substance that can be fused or melted.
examples: Try any fusibles you have on hand, making sure that they aren't too stiff for the project you have in mind.
